data.title: Calendar: Martinsville-area events Thursday, Aug. 8
data.text:
TODAY

Buffalo Ridge, Fairystone, and Pole Bridge Community Watch Meeting: 7 p.m., Sycamore Baptist Church, 179 Sycamore Church Lane, Stuart. The guest speaker will be Patrick County Conservation Police Officer Dale Owens, who will be speaking about new hunting and fishing laws.

FRIDAY

Exhibit Opening Reception – History and Legend, Lingering, and the Lynwood Artists: 5:30 p.m., Piedmont Arts. Free and open to the public. Complimentary wine and light refreshments. Live music. RSVP by calling the museum at 276-632-3221 or on www.PiedmontArts.org

TheatreWorks Community Players “The Shape of Things” showtimes: 7 p.m. on Aug. 9,10,16 and 17, 2 p.m. on Aug. 11 and 18; tickets $15 at twcp.net.

Renewal Brewing: 7 p.m.; Dos Guitars, Live jazz/blues guitar.

Cascade School Community Center Music and Dance: 7-9:30 p.m., 3561 Huntington Trail, Cascade, with Glass Heart; $8.

SATURDAY

Bassett Ruritan Club All You Can Eat Breakfast: 6-10 a.m., 277 Philpott Dam Rd., Bassett. Menu includes sausage, fried bologna, eggs, gravy, made from scratch biscuits, cooked apples, coffee and juice, made to order regular and buckwheat pancakes. $8 for adults and $4 for children under 12. Eat in or carry out.

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

Jennifer Short Education Scholarship Benefit Ride: 10:30 a.m. registration, 12:30 p.m. kickstands up, Fraternal Order of Eagles #3739, 210 Mill Creek Drive, Bassett.

Uptown Martinsville Food Truck Pull-up and Cruise-in: 3-8 p.m., uptown Martinsville. Delicious eats and classic cars.

Ridgeway Ruritan Club barbecue dinner: 5-7 p.m., 111 Magnolia St., Ridgeway. Barbecue chicken quarters or pulled pork, roll, coleslaw, baked beans, homemade dessert and drink. Dine in or take out. $12. Preorder by calling 276-340-5228, 276-734-9359, or 276-806-6110.

Monday

Citizen’s Police Academy: 8:30 a.m.-5 p.m., Piedmont Regional Criminal Justice Academy, 1024 Dupont Road, Martinsville. Lunch will be provided. Specific area of instruction on traffic stops, police and media relations, overview of new laws, and round table discussion. Call 276-226-6609 to register.

Martinsville City Public Schools board meeting: 6 p.m., MCPS Central Office, 746 Indian Tr.

TUESDAY

TOPS meeting: 9 a.m. weigh-in, 10 a.m. meeting, Chatham Heights Baptist Church, 1235 Chatham Heights Road, Martinsville.

Chix with Sticks: 10:30 a.m., Piedmont Arts: Knitters are invited to work together in the Piedmont Arts classroom. Sessions are self-guided and provide a space to socialize while creating. Bring your own supplies. Advanced registration required. Free to members, $5 for nonmembers who will pay at the door.

Open Studio: 1 p.m., Piedmont Arts; 1-3 p.m., Open Studio is offered every Tuesday from 1-3 p.m. Artists of all ages are invited to craft and create together in the Piedmont Arts classroom. Sessions are self-guided and provide a space to socialize, learn and share with fellow artists. Bring your own supplies. Free to members and $5 for non-members. Pay at door.

WEDNESDAY

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

THURSDAY, Aug. 15

Make Some Noise: Open Mic Series: 7 p.m., Piedmont Arts. Free admission, cash bar available.

Stress Management class: 12-1 p.m., P&HCC; $70; call 276-656-0260.

FRIDAY, Aug. 16

Rotary Club of Martinsville-Henry County TGIF concert series: 6 p.m. gates open; music begins at 7 p.m.; $7 admission, under 12 free; all concerts will be at the Bridge Street parking lot uptown Martinsville; food by Hugo’s adult beverages, beverages by Lawrence Distributing Co.; “Radio Revolver.”

Renewal Brewing: 7 p.m., Nashville Blues legend, Stacy Mitchhart, a renowned blues guitarist, will perform live at Renewal Brewing as part of his “Other Side of Nashville” tour. Tickets: https://app.opendate.io/e/stacy-mitchhart-august-16-2024-545610

Cascade School Community Center Music and Dance: 7-9:30 p.m., 3561 Huntington Trail, Cascade, with Oldskool; $8.

SATURDAY, Aug. 17

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

Smith River Cleanup: 9 a.m.-2 p.m., Smith River Sports Complex, Axton. Everyone is invited to give a few hours to help cleanup the water and land around it. Bring canoes, jon boats, kayaks and river shoes. Catered lunch will be provided. Sponsored by the Dan River Basin Association.

MONDAY, Aug. 19

The Patrick County Chamber of Commerce casual get together: 8-10 a.m., P&HCC, Stuart location; with local businesses and groups to start working on calendars for the upcoming holiday season. This event is free but please RSVP here: https://bit.ly/PCXMasplanning

TUESDAY, Aug. 20

TOPS meeting: 9 a.m. weigh-in, 10 a.m. meeting, Chatham Heights Baptist Church, 1235 Chatham Heights Road, Martinsville.

Open Studio: 1 p.m., Piedmont Arts; 1-3 p.m., Open Studio is offered every Tuesday from 1-3 p.m. Artists of all ages are invited to craft and create together in the Piedmont Arts classroom. Sessions are self-guided and provide a space to socialize, learn and share with fellow artists. Bring your own supplies. Free to members and $5 for non-members. Pay at door.

History In Maps: 4:30-5:30 p.m., Martinsville Main Library; guest lecturer Josh Schaller will present an historical lecture with geographical references via archival maps on Martinsville and Henry County; registration required by calling, 276-403-5430.

WEDNESDAY, Aug. 21

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

Basic Contractor Licensing class: 8 a.m.-4:30 p.m., P&HCC; $189; pre-registration required at ph.augusoft.net or 276-656-0260.

FRIDAY, Aug. 23

Cascade School Community Center Music and Dance: 7-9:30 p.m., 3561 Huntington Trail, Cascade, with Bullet Band; $8.

SATURDAY, Aug. 24

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

Smith River Fest: 10 a.m.-4 p.m., Smith River Sports Complex, 1000 Irisburg Road, Axton. Entertainment, Helgramite Hustle Mud Run, boat race, and vendors. Admission and parking are free.

American Legion Homer Dillard Post #78 Fish Fry: 10 a.m.-4 p.m., 139 Creekside Drive, Martinsville. Drive-thru with limited dining-in. Fish sandwiches $8, homemade desserts $2, soft drinks and water for $1.

Movies in the Park: Mountain Top Park in Patrick County featuring “The Croods: A New Age.” Showing begins at dusk.

TUESDAY, Aug. 27

TOPS meeting: 9 a.m. weigh-in, 10 a.m. meeting, Chatham Heights Baptist Church, 1235 Chatham Heights Road, Martinsville.

Chix with Sticks: 10:30 a.m., Piedmont Arts: Knitters are invited to work together in the Piedmont Arts classroom. Sessions are self-guided and provide a space to socialize while creating. Bring your own supplies. Advanced registration required. Free to members, $5 for nonmembers who will pay at the door.

Open Studio: 1 p.m., Piedmont Arts; 1-3 p.m., Open Studio is offered every Tuesday from 1-3 p.m. Artists of all ages are invited to craft and create together in the Piedmont Arts classroom. Sessions are self-guided and provide a space to socialize, learn and share with fellow artists. Bring your own supplies. Free to members and $5 for non-members. Pay at door.

Henry County Board of Supervisors meeting: 3 p.m. and 6 p.m., Summerlin Room, Henry County Administration Building.

WEDNESDAY, Aug. 28

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

Congressman Morgan Griffith’s Ninth District traveling staff office hours: Martinsville City Hall, Council Chambers, 55 W. Church St., Martinsville, 10 a.m.-11:30 a.m.; Patrick County Administration Building, Conference Room, 106 Rucker Street, Stuart, 12:30-2 p.m.

FRIDAY, Aug. 30

Live Jazz: 6:30-7:30 p.m., Martinsville Main Library; featuring jazz pianist Trevor Percario; $5 supply fee; hors d’oeuvres served; registration required; for more information, contact library at 276-403-5430.

Cascade School Community Center Music and Dance: 7-9:30 p.m., 3561 Huntington Trail, Cascade, with Brian Ellis and The REAL Country Band; $8.

SATURDAY, Aug. 31

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

Listen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts

50 Year Class Reunion of 1974: 6 p.m., Heritage Conference & Event Center; contact Terry at 434-384-6028 or Teena at 540-238-9265.

TUESDAY, Sept. 3

Genealogy research class: Each Tuesday in September from 10 a.m.-12 p.m., Bassett Historical Center. The instructor is Cindy Headen, genealogy clerk at the Center. Classes are limited to 12 people. Call 276-629-9191. There is no charge.

WEDNESDAY, Sept. 4

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

THURSDAY, Sept. 5

Professional Development — Leadership class: Building Stronger Teams: noon-2 p.m. P&HCC; $99; call, 276-656-6260.

FRIDAY, Sept. 6

Sounds on the Square: 7-10 p.m., Plaza of the Historic Henry County Courthouse, 1 East Main St.; The Ghosts of Liberty; Scuffle Hill Brewing Company will sell craft beers, and at least one food truck will be present; admission is free.

WEDNESDAY, Sept. 11

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

FRIDAY, Sept. 13

Sounds on the Square: 7-10 p.m., Plaza of the Historic Henry County Courthouse, 1 East Main St..; “Line Dancing on the Square” with Sue Ann Ehmann; Scuffle Hill Brewing Company will sell craft beers, and at least one food truck will be present; admission is free.

SATURDAY, Sept. 14

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

Henry County Sheriff’s Office Benevolent Fund Captains Choice Golf Tournament: 8-9 a.m. registration, 9:15 a.m. shotgun start, Forest Park County Club. This event is open to the public. $240 team admission (includes the tournament, lunch, fun and prizes).

WEDNESDAY, Sept. 18

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

FRIDAY, Sept. 20

Rotary Club of Martinsville-Henry County TGIF concert series: 6 p.m. gates open; music begins at 7 p.m.; $7 admission, under 12 free; all concerts will be at the Bridge Street parking lot uptown Martinsville; food by Hugo’s adult beverages, beverages by Lawrence Distributing Company; “Turn It Up.”

SATURDAY, Sept. 21

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

Movies in the Park: Patrick Springs Park in Patrick County featuring “The Nightmare Before Christmas.” Showing begins at dusk.

TUESDAY, Sept. 24

Henry County Board of Supervisors meeting: 3 p.m. and 6 p.m., Summerlin Room, Henry County Administration Building.

WEDNESDAY, Sept. 25

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

SATURDAY, Sept. 28

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

FRIDAY, Oct. 4

Sounds on the Square: 7-10 p.m., Plaza of the Historic Henry County Courthouse, 1 East Main St.; Andy Burnette Trio; Scuffle Hill Brewing Company will sell craft beers, and at least one food truck will be present; admission is free.

SATURDAY, Oct. 5

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

THURSDAY, Oct. 10

Giving and Receiving Constructive Feedback class: noon-2 p.m., P&HCC; $70; call 276-656-0260.

SATURDAY, Oct. 12

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

SATURDAY, Oct. 19

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

TUESDAY, Oct. 22

Henry County Board of Supervisors meeting: 3 p.m. and 6 p.m., Summerlin Room, Henry County Administration Building.

SATURDAY, Oct. 26

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

SATURDAY, Nov. 2

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

THURSDAY, Nov. 7

Strengthening People Skills in the Workplace class: noon-2 p.m., P&HCC; $70, call 276-656-0260.

SATURDAY, Nov. 9

Uptown Martinsville Farmers’ Market: 7:30 a.m. to noon, 65 W. Main St.

SATURDAY, Nov. 16

Uptown Martinsville Farmers Market: 7:30 a.m.-12 p.m., 65 W. Main St.

Basic Contractor Licensing class: 8 a.m.-4:30 p.m., P&HCC; $189; pre-registration required at ph.augusoft.net or 276-656-0260.

THURSDAY, Nov. 21

Preparing and Delivering Effective Presentations class: noon-1 p.m., P&HCC; $70, call 276-656-0260.

TUESDAY, Nov. 26

Henry County Board of Supervisors meeting: 3 p.m. and 6 p.m., Summerlin Room, Henry County Administration Building.

WEDNESDAY, Dec. 17

Henry County Board of Supervisors meeting: 3 p.m. and 6 p.m., Summerlin Room, Henry County Administration Building.

THURSDAY, Jan. 9

Make Some Noise: Open Mic Series: 7 p.m., Piedmont Arts. Free admission, cash bar available.

THURSDAY, April 10

Make Some Noise: Open Mic Series: 7 p.m., Piedmont Arts. Free admission, cash bar available.
